title: Hamilton General Hospital
text:
The Hamilton General Hospital (HGH) is a major <a href="teaching%20hospital">teaching hospital</a> in Downtown <a href="Hamilton%2C%20Ontario">Hamilton</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>, Canada, located at the intersection of <a href="Barton%20Street%20%28Hamilton%2C%20Ontario%29">Barton Street East</a> and <a href="Victoria%20Avenue%20%28Hamilton%2C%20Ontario%29">Victoria Avenue North</a>. It is operated by <a href="Hamilton%20Health%20Sciences">Hamilton Health Sciences</a> and is formally affiliated with the <a href="Michael%20G.%20DeGroote%20School%20of%20Medicine">Michael G. DeGroote School of Medicine</a> at <a href="McMaster%20University">McMaster University</a>.
HGH is one of the largest cardiac surgical centres in Canada, performing over 1,600 open heart surgeries annually. The hospital generated of research income in 2013, second to the <a href="University%20Health%20Network">University Health Network</a> amongst research hospitals in Canada, and representing 14.8% of its income.
History.
Founded in 1848, the hospital became a part of <a href="Hamilton%20Health%20Sciences">Hamilton Health Sciences</a> in 1996 when Hamilton General, <a href="Juravinski%20Hospital">Henderson General</a>, <a href="McMaster%20University%20Medical%20Centre">McMaster University Medical Centre</a>, <a href="McMaster%20Children%27s%20Hospital">McMaster Children's Hospital</a> and <a href="Chedoke%20Hospital">Chedoke Hospital</a> merged. This union formed one of the largest teaching hospitals in Ontario, operating across four sites with approximately 8,000 employees and 1,000 physicians. Other hospitals soon followed.
Facilities.
The hospital is equipped with a rooftop <a href="helipad">helipad</a> .
Hamilton General Hospital is a regional centre specializing in cardiac and vascular care, neuroscience, trauma and burn treatment, stroke and rehabilitation. It is home to the state-of-the-art Dofasco Heart Investigation Unit; one of the province’s few rooftop heliports; a Level 1 trauma centre and the second busiest burn unit in Ontario. Also located at the General site are the Regional Rehabilitation Centre and the David Braley Cardiac, Vascular and Stroke Research Institute.
The "David Braley Cardiac, Vascular and Stroke Research Institute" is a research centre located behind the Hamilton General Hospital. It is home to more than 400 staff and researchers. The new building with opened 11 March 2010. At least 250 new jobs will be added to the local economy. <a href="David%20Braley">David Braley</a>, for whom the institute is named, contributed $10 million towards the project.
Fundraising.
The Hamilton Health Sciences Foundation raises funds for capital projects, equipment and research needs of Hamilton General Hospital.
